content: अनुग्रह् {c9c} <ab>P.</ab> (<ab>Ved.</ab> --गृभ्णाति) {@--1@} To favour, oblige, treat with kindness; शिलातलैकदेशमनुगृह्णानु वयस्यः <ls>Ś. 3</ls> our friend will be so good as to, or kindly, take a seat on the stone; अयं विष्टरोऽनुगृह्यतां <ls>V. 5</ls> be pleased to sit down &c.; महेंद्रेण पुनरनुगृहीता <ls>V. 3</ls> favoured (by modifying the curse); with <ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>abl.</ab> of that which is an obligation; अनुगृहीतोऽहमनया मघवतः संभावनया <ls>Ś. 6</ls>; कतरत्कुलमनुगृहीतं भगवत्या जन्मना <ls>K. 135</ls>; अनुगृहीतोऽस्मि अहमुपदेशाद्भवतः <ls>V. 4</ls> I am much obliged to you &c. (अनुगृहीत is <ab>oft.</ab> used by itself in the sense of ‘much obliged’, ‘many thanks,’ ‘I thank you’, ‘I esteem it a favour’). {@--2@} To foster, cherish, protect, maintain (as fire); अग्निर्नित्यानुगृहीतः स्यात् <ls>Āśval.</ls> {@--3@} To receive, welcome. {@--4@} To hold up, support, uphold. {@--5@} To follow in robbing, seizing or depriving. {@--6@} To keep to, conform or correspond to, follow, take after; आकृतिमनुगृह्णंति गुणाः <ls>Vb. 2</ls>; क्षात्रधर्मश्चानुगृहीतो भवति <ls>U. 5.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} To cause to favour, or to favour; आर्यस्य दर्शनेनात्मानमनुग्राहयितुं <ls>Mu. 4.</ls>
